intro: Sabatia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf sandplain pink, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and typically grows in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy pink to red flowers that bloom from June to September. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dunes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
